N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 118.9 - Decision

State Regulations
(a) The hearing
officer shall render his decision based upon the entire record before him, and
that decision shall be based upon substantial evidence found in the record. Findings of fact and conclusions of law shall be accompanied by a concise and
explicit statement of the underlying facts supporting the findings. (b) If the decision of the hearing officer is
in favor of the State Comptroller, then the State Comptroller shall execute a
written certification, upon his seal, specifying the abandoned property
reportable and payable or deliverable to the State Comptroller. A copy of said
certification shall be sent by certified mail to the person holding any such
abandoned property. (c) Pursuant to
section
1412
(4)
of the Abandoned Property Law, the 90
days within which any aggrieved person may institute a special proceeding
pursuant to article 78 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules shall begin to run
when the certification is received by such aggrieved person. Notes
